title: PIER ORB / communistquest
description: Rhetoric smells a communist around here. Part of the Communist Dream Quest

dialogueTree.title: Rhetoric: "There it is again! There's a spectr..."
dialogueTree.english: There it is again! There's a spectral scent haunting this pier, no doubt. And it smells like...
dialogueTree.polish: Znowu jest! Ten pomost nawiedza jakiś upiorny zapach. Czuć tu...
dialogueTree.belarusian: Зноў ёсць! Гэты мост наведвае нейкі страхотны пах. Адчуваецца тут...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Sea brine, mostly. Because it's a p..."
links.english: Sea brine, mostly. Because it's a pier.
links.polish: Głównie solą morską. W końcu to pomost.
links.belarusian: У асноўным марская соль. У рэшце рэшт, гэта мост.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Years of turmoil, of hopes and drea..."
links.english: Years of turmoil, of hopes and dreams ground beneath the inexorable tides of capital.
links.polish: Lata niepokojów, nadziei i marzeń obróconych w proch uderzeniami niezmordowanych fal kapitału.
links.belarusian: Гады неспакою, надзеі і мрояў, знішчаных ударамі нястомных хваляў капіталу.

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.english: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)
links.polish: (Zamknij oczy i weź głęboki oddech).
links.belarusian: (Заплюшчы вочы і зрабі глыбокі ўдых).

links.title: You: "I *still* don't smell anything."
links.english: I *still* don't smell anything.
links.polish: *Nadal* nic nie czuję.
links.belarusian: *Пакуль* нічога не адчуваю.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Absolute rubbish. Your politico-olf..."
links.english: Absolute rubbish. Your politico-olfactory cortex doesn't deceive you. The smell is coming... from that balcony over there!
links.polish: Co za bzdura. Twoja kora polityczno-węchowa nie kłamie. Ten zapach dochodzi... z tamtego balkonu!
links.belarusian: Што за дурніца. Твая палітычна-нюхальная кара не хлусіць. Гэты пах зыходзіць ... з таго балкона!

links.title: You: "I can *kind of* smell dreams being..."
links.english: I can *kind of* smell dreams being ground down by capital.
links.polish: Czuję *odrobinę* zapach marzeń ścieranych na proch przez kapitał.
links.belarusian: Адчуваю *кроплю* паху мар, расцёртых у парашок капіталам.

links.title: You: "Smell what?"
links.english: Smell what?
links.polish: Ale co?
links.belarusian: Але што?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Can you not detect that inimitable..."
links.english: Can you not detect that inimitable whiff of dissatisfaction and restlessness, that sense that the world is in need of dramatic, even violent re-ordering?
links.polish: Naprawdę nie wyczuwasz tego niemożliwego do podrobienia aromatu niezadowolenia i niepokoju? Poczucia, że świat potrzebuje dramatycznej, brutalnej wręcz zmiany w swoim porządku?
links.belarusian: Вы сапраўды не адчуваеце гэтага немагчымага для падробкі водару незадаволенасці і трывогі? Адчування, што свету патрэбна драматычная, нават брутальная змена ў ягоным парадку?

links.title: You: "(Close your eyes and take a deep br..."
links.english: (Close your eyes and take a deep breath.)
links.polish: (Zamknij oczy i weź głęboki oddech).
links.belarusian: (Закрый вочы і зрабі глыбокі ўдых).

links.title: Rhetoric: "What do you smell?"
links.english: What do you smell?
links.polish: Co czujesz?
links.belarusian: Што ты адчуваеш?

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The first thing that strikes you is..."
links.english: The first thing that strikes you is the overwhelming brine. You imagine yourself underwater, a hundred-legged arthropod scuttling along the murky silt at the bottom of the sea...
links.polish: Pierwszym, co uderza w twoje nozdrza, jest wszechobecna sól. Wyobrażasz sobie, że jesteś podwodnym stworzeniem – stawonogiem o stu odnóżach kroczącym po zalegającym na dnie morza mule...
links.belarusian: Першым, што ўдарыць у твае ноздры, - гэта ўсюдыісная соль. Уяўляеш сабе, што ты падводнае стварэнне - членістаногае са ста нагамі, якое крочыць па іле на дне мора...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "But then the unmistakable reek of *..."
links.english: But then the unmistakable reek of *seagull shit* hits you, buoyed along on the air currents, an acrid melody atop mouldering chords of wood rot and heavy fuel oil.
links.polish: Później jednak dociera do ciebie niesiony prądami powietrza, niemożliwy do pomylenia z czymkolwiek innym smród *mewiego gówna*. Kwaśna melodia zbudowana na gnuśnych akordach gnijącego drewna i ciężkiego oleju napędowego.
links.belarusian: Пазней, аднак, да цябе даходзіць, несены паветранымі патокамі, непамылковы з чымсьці іншым смурод *чайкавага гаўна*. Кіслотная мелодыя, пабудаваная на апатычных акордах гніючага дрэва і цяжкага дызельнага алею.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Still smelling for communists, det..."
links.english: "Still smelling for communists, detective?"
links.polish: „Wciąż węszysz za komunistami, detektywie?”
links.belarusian: "Всё яшчэ вынюхваеш за камуністамі, дэтэктыве?"

links.title: You: ""Yes.""
links.english: "Yes."
links.polish: „Tak”.
links.belarusian: "Так".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, I'll be over here when you'v..."
links.english: "Well, I'll be over here when you've finished." The lieutenant nudges a piece of trash with his foot.
links.polish: „Dobrze, poczekam tutaj, aż skończysz” – mówi porucznik, trącając czubkiem buta leżący na ziemi śmieć.
links.belarusian: "Добра, пачакаю тут, пакуль скончыш", — кажа лейтэнант, крануўшы наском бота смецце, якое ляжыць на зямлі.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "His impatience is feigned. He's act..."
links.english: His impatience is feigned. He's actually curious to see how this *personal errand* shakes out.
links.polish: To udawana niecierpliwość. Jest tak naprawdę ciekaw, jak się ta twoja *sprawa osobista* zakończy.
links.belarusian: Гэта прыкідлівае нецярпенне. Насамрэч яму цікава, як скончыцца гэтая твая *асабістая справа*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He'll tolerate this *personal erran..."
links.english: He'll tolerate this *personal errand*, but his patience is wearing thin.
links.polish: Toleruje twoją *sprawę osobistą*, ale jego cierpliwość jest na wyczerpaniu.
links.belarusian: Талерантую тваю *асабістую справу*, але ягонае цярпенне на зыходзе.

links.title: You: ""No.""
links.english: "No."
links.polish: „Nie”.
links.belarusian: "Не".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Uh huh.""
links.english: "Uh huh."
links.polish: „Mhm”.
links.belarusian: "Мгм".

links.title: Drama: "The lieutenant issss *not* persuade..."
links.english: The lieutenant issss *not* persuaded, sssssire.
links.polish: Porucznik *nie jesssst* przekonany, ssssszanowny panie.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант *не ўпэўнены*, паважаны пан.

links.title: Rhetoric: "What the lieutenant thinks is irrel..."
links.english: What the lieutenant thinks is irrelevant. Your politico-olfactory cortex is lighting up like a holiday display. The scent of communism is overwhelming, and it's coming right... from that balcony over there!
links.polish: To, co myśli porucznik, jest bez znaczenia. Twoja kora polityczno-węchowa rozpędziła się niczym lokomotywa. Zapach komunizmu jest wręcz przytłaczający, dobiega zaś... z tamtego balkonu!
links.belarusian: Тое, што думае лейтэнант, не мае значэння. Твая палітычна-нюхавая кара разагналася, як паравоз. Запах камунізму проста задушлівы, ён зыходзіць... з таго балкона!

links.title: You: ""What makes you say that?""
links.english: "What makes you say that?"
links.polish: „Czemu tak mówisz?”
links.belarusian: "Чаму ты так кажаш?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No offence, detective, but you're..."
links.english: "No offence, detective, but you're not particularly *subtle*."
links.polish: „Bez urazy, detektywie, ale nie jesteś szczególnie *subtelny*”.
links.belarusian: "Без крыўды, дэтэктыў, але вы не асабліва *зачэплены*".

links.title: Savoir Faire: "The lieutenant's right. It's sort o..."
links.english: The lieutenant's right. It's sort of amazing how *un-subtly* you're sniffing the air around you, almost like you're *trying* to call attention to yourself.
links.polish: Porucznik ma rację. To aż niesamowite, jak *niesubtelnie* węszysz wokół. Jakbyś nieomal *próbował* ściągnąć na siebie uwagę.
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант мае рацыю. Гэта ажно неверагодна, як *нятонка* ты сноўдаеш вакол. Як быццам ты амаль *спрабуеш* прыцягнуць да сябе ўвагу.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Everything in order, detective?" T..."
links.english: "Everything in order, detective?" The lieutenant gives you a quizzical look.
links.polish: „Wszystko w porządku, detektywie?” – porucznik spogląda na ciebie ze zdziwieniem.
links.belarusian: "Усё ў парадку, дэтэктыве?" – лейтэнант глядзіць на цябе з здзіўленнем.

links.title: You: ""It's kind of a personal errand.""
links.english: "It's kind of a personal errand."
links.polish: „To taka dość osobista sprawa”.
links.belarusian: "Гэта даволі асабістая справа".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A personal errand.""
links.english: "A personal errand."
links.polish: „Osobista sprawa”.
links.belarusian: "Асабістая справа".

links.title: You: ""I'm smelling for communists, Kim.""
links.english: "I'm smelling for communists, Kim."
links.polish: „Węszę za komunistami, Kim”.
links.belarusian: "Шукаю камуністаў, Кім".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're smelling for...""
links.english: "You're smelling for..."
links.polish: „Węszysz za...”
links.belarusian: "Нюхаеш за..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know what? I'll just leave you..."
links.english: "You know what? I'll just leave you to it. Carry on, detective."
links.polish: „Wiesz co? Rób sobie, co chcesz, detektywie. Nie przeszkadzaj sobie”.
links.belarusian: "Ведаеш што? Рабі, што хочаш, дэтэктыву. Не перашкаджай сабе".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm struggling to see the connecti..."
links.english: "I'm struggling to see the connection with our investigation, but I'm sure *all will be revealed* in time."
links.polish: „Nie umiem dostrzec, jak wiąże się to z naszym śledztwem, ale nie wątpię, że *wszystko się z czasem ujawni*”.
links.belarusian: "Не магу зразумець, як гэта звязана з нашым расследаваннем, але не сумняваюся, што *з цягам часу ўсё стане вядома*".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You do remember that we're investi..."
links.english: "You do remember that we're investigating a *murder*, yes? I would appreciate it if you reserved your political projects for after-hours."
links.polish: „Pamiętasz, że zajmujemy się sprawą *morderstwa*, prawda? Byłbym wdzięczny, gdybyś swoje polityczne projekty realizował po godzinach pracy”.
links.belarusian: "Памятаеш, што мы займаемся справай *забойства*, праўда? Я быў бы ўдзячны, калі б ты рэалізоўваў свае палітычныя праекты пасля працоўных гадзін".

links.title: Rhetoric: "The lieutenant lacks your highly de..."
links.english: The lieutenant lacks your highly developed politico-olfactory cortex. The smell is undeniable. And it's coming... from that balcony up there!
links.polish: Porucznik nie posiada twojej wysoce rozwiniętej kory polityczno-węchowej. Zapach jest ewidentny. I dobiega on... z tamtego balkonu!
links.belarusian: Лейтэнант не валодае вашай высокаразвітай карой палітычна-нюхавой. Запах відавочны. І ён ідзе... з таго балкона!

links.title: You: ""I'm working on developing my polit..."
links.english: "I'm working on developing my political consciousness."
links.polish: „Pracuję nad rozwijaniem swojej politycznej świadomości”.
links.belarusian: "Я працую над развіццём сваёй палітычнай свядомасці".

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're developing your...""
links.english: "You're developing your..."
links.polish: „Rozwijaniem swojej...”
links.belarusian: "Развіццём сваёй..."

links.title: You: ""Just taking in the fresh air, like..."
links.english: "Just taking in the fresh air, like a normal detective."
links.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
links.belarusian: "Я радуюся свежаму паветру, як любы нармальны дэтэктыў".

Alternate1.english: "Just taking in the morning air, like a normal detective."
Alternate1.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym porannym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate1.belarusian: „Я атрымліваю асалоду ад свежага ранішняга паветра, як і кожны нармальны дэтэктыў”.

Alternate2.english: "Just taking in the afternoon air, like a normal detective."
Alternate2.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym popołudniowym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate2.belarusian: «Я радуюся свежаму папаўдзённаму паветру, як кожны нармальны дэтэктыў».

Alternate3.english: "Just taking in the evening air, like a normal detective."
Alternate3.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym wieczornym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate3.belarusian: «Я радуюся свежым вечаровым паветрам, як кожны нармальны дэтэктыў».

Alternate4.english: "Just taking in the night air, like a normal detective."
Alternate4.polish: „Cieszę się świeżym nocnym powietrzem, jak każdy normalny detektyw”.
Alternate4.belarusian: «Я атрымліваю задавальненне ад свежага начнога паветра, як любы нармальны дэтэктыў».

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a lot to take in, isn't th..."
links.english: "There's a lot to take in, isn't there?" The lieutenant wrinkles his nose.
links.polish: „Dużo tu powodów do radości, co?” – mówi porucznik, marszcząc nos.
links.belarusian: "Шмат тут прычын для радасці, што?" – кажа лейтэнант, моршчыўшы нос.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "It smells like a pier, in other wor..."
links.english: It smells like a pier, in other words. A completely ordinary pier, that provokes no ideological associations whatsoever.
links.polish: Innymi słowy, czuć tu pomostem. Najzwyklejszym, takim, który nie budzi żadnych ideologicznych skojarzeń.
links.belarusian: Іншымі словамі, тут адчуваецца мост. Самы звычайны, такі, які не выклікае ніякіх ідэалагічных асацыяцый.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "Nothing. Or at least, nothing in pa..."
links.english: Nothing. Or at least, nothing in particular. As far as you're concerned, your nose seems to be purely decorative.
links.polish: Nic. A przynajmniej nic konkretnego. W gruncie rzeczy twój nos mógłby mieć czysto dekoracyjną funkcję.
links.belarusian: Нічога. А прынамсі нічога канкрэтнага. Уласна кажучы, твой нос мог бы мець чыста дэкаратыўную функцыю.

links.title: You: "Are you saying there's a communist..."
links.english: Are you saying there's a communist nearby?
links.polish: Twierdzisz, że w pobliżu jest komunista?
links.belarusian: Вы сцвярджаеце, што паблізу ёсць камуніст?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Without a doubt. Your politico-olfa..."
links.english: Without a doubt. Your politico-olfactory cortex doesn't deceive you. The smell is coming... from that balcony over there!
links.polish: Bez wątpienia. Twoja kora polityczno-węchowa nie kłamie. Ten zapach dochodzi... z tamtego balkonu!
links.belarusian: Без сумневу. Твая кара палітычна-нюхавая не хлусіць. Гэты пах ідзе... з таго балкона!

links.title: You: "You mean from Cindy?"
links.english: You mean from Cindy?
links.polish: Znaczy się, od Cindy?
links.belarusian: Гэта значыць, ад Сіндзі?

links.title: Rhetoric: "Certainement! A precocious communis..."
links.english: Certainement! A precocious communist youth, a symbol of a kinder, more hopeful future. Now's your chance to *establish contact* with your revolutionary brothers and sisters.
links.polish: Certainement! Przedwcześnie dojrzała komunistyczna młódka, symbol lepszej, niosącej więcej nadziei przyszłości. Oto twoja szansa na *nawiązanie kontaktu* z twoimi rewolucyjnymi braćmi i siostrami.
links.belarusian: Вядома! Перадчасна сталы камуністычны дзяўчынка, сімвал лепшай, больш надзеючай будучыні. Вось ваш шанец на *ўстанаўленне кантакту* з вашымі рэвалюцыйнымі братамі і сёстрамі.

links.title: Inland Empire: "A chance to establish contact with..."
links.english: A chance to establish contact with the future! What a beautiful, *terrible* thought...
links.polish: Szansa na nawiązanie kontaktu z przyszłością! Co za piękna, ale i *straszna* myśl...
links.belarusian: Шанец на ўсталяванне кантакту з будучыняй! Якая прыгожая, але і страшная думка...

links.title: You: "You mean from that scary-looking gi..."
links.english: You mean from that scary-looking girl in the old lady coat?
links.polish: Znaczy się, od tej groźnie wyglądającej dziewczyny w babcinym płaszczu?
links.belarusian: Значыць, ад гэтай пагрозлівай дзяўчыны ў бабуліным паліто?

links.title: You: "I don't smell anything."
links.english: I don't smell anything.
links.polish: Nic nie czuję.
links.belarusian: Я нічога не адчуваю.
